bio.p: Yangling Zhou received her PhD in mechanical engineering from the University of Maryland, Baltimore County (UMBC) in 2018. After that, she continued her research on the development of rotation-free shell element for red blood cell simulation as a postdoctoral fellow in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at UMBC. From 2018 to 2019, she worked as a research fellow at the U.S. FDA to evaluate the performance of IR thermographs for fever screening.
